body.name: Acer Predator BiFrost AMD Radeon RX7600 Overclocking Graphics Card | 8GB GDDR6 128-bit 18 Gbps | Dual Fan Hybrid Cooling and Vapor Chamber | TPD 180W | 1 x HDMI 2.1 & 3 x DisplayPort 1.4
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 2 hrs 5 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 13. Order within 14 hrs 35 mins
features: GPU Clock: Graphics Clock 2.32GHz | OC Boost Clock 2.725GHz
Memory Spec: 8GB GDDR6 VRAM Memory | 128bit Memory Bandwidth | 18Gbps Memory Speed
GPU Power/Thermal: TPD (Total Design Power) 180W | PCIe Power PCIe 8pin

body.description: Deck out your PC with the latest graphics with the Predator BIFROST AMD Radeon RX7600 OC. Experience unprecedented performance, visuals, and efficiency for gaming and streaming in 1080p with the AMD Radeon RX 7600 OC graphics card powered by RDNA 3 architecture. Conquer all the latest AAA games at high resolutions and refresh rates while seamlessly streaming your victories. Get more done with powerful content creation abilities from processing 8K HDR video to accelerating 3D workloads. (DP.Z36WW.P02 )

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.0 4.0 out of 5 stars 117 ratings 4.0 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great performance at low price. No problems so far.
reviews.reviewText: The installation was simple but lengthy. I have a 10850kf cpu and my motherboard needed a BIOS update for the rebar. After installing the drivers and before doing the BIOS update, the GPU was running like a slide show. BIOS update took a while, lots and lots of reboots but finally had the rebar enable option in the BIOS and GPU started working well.I have the GPU mounted vertically and I thought the RGB would look good but it is kind of dull looking in real life. The first fan has a very dull looking RGB and the second fan has some RGB but barely there. I don't think the RGB quality looks as good as they advertise in the box. But, it is OK enough looking and not too bad; just not as good as I thought it was going to be.The GPU came with the Assassin's Creed game and the code came in the next day after delivery. It is running 60 fps on high settings on ultra-wide 1440p system. The game runs smoothly enough that I'm immersed and enjoying it. There are some hitches when loading levels but gameplay is smooth.Overall, for the price it is a good card and happy with it. Aesthetics could be better but its not too bad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I upgraded from a Nvidia 1080 to this card and I couldn't be happier. I get better FPS and higher detail resolution than I did with the 1080. It took a lot for me to upgrade from the 1080, it was a workhorse. I read some of the reviews with Intel and the problems with their software but it seems those are fixed. This is a great card. I got it for less than $350.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Frustrating Video Card - I really wanted to like it
reviews.reviewText: Review update---- I had to RMA the video card the small middle fan goes bad after a few months of usage. I start hearing a bad wine during startup and gameplay, I took it to my local computer repair shop and they said the middle small fan is loose and causing the issue. So, I recommend not buying the ACER version, the tech told me that the small fan is prone to brake, bad design and cheaply made.Well, I took a chance on trying the Intel arc a770 in my new system build and I can say it was a big mistake. Constant issues from the beginning, it will not run my favorite older shooter games like Soldier of Fortune II, it constantly crashes during game play, playing COD2 and it crashes after about 30 minutes of gameplay with the "fatal error" notification, it is a great looking video card and seems to run pretty cool.I notified new drivers were increasing performance according to intel, but there is so much wrong with the Arc intel video card, that just did not help, so I will be returning it. I wanted to give it a shot, but intel really screwed this up, I just thought a high tech company like intel would do a lot better job in creating a gaming discrete graphics card, especially since they brought on high level AMD employees to help out, I guess it did not work out. I still hope they can fix the issues and release a better video card in the near future, since I am getting tired of AMD and NVIDIA charging over 1,200 - 2,000 graphics card that no one can afford or obtain, we need more tech companies involved in making GPU's to bring down the prices and give us alternatives to AMD and NVIDIA's stranglehold on the GPU marked. Common Intel, figure it out already.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than I expected
reviews.reviewText: Nice looking card that performs better than I thought. I run this on my backup box with an i5 12600k and 32gb ddr5 5600. It runs 3440x1440 well enough though I suspect it would really shine at normal 1440p. It’s a nice looking card and temps aren’t terrible. I mostly bought it to support intel and try to get another player in the game. Intel Arc control is crap and after two fresh installs of windows, it still freezes instantly any time I try to run it. Not really needed software anyway. Just don’t forget to make sure resize bar is enabled.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars works good 1140p or qled
reviews.reviewText: have not had an serious deal breakers yet it runs well enough on what games I triedit runs D4 smooth as glass and I had a few stutters in town but they went away once the game synched up fully Loaded the shadersinstall was easy the card practically jumped infired up the pc and uh oh no video and the motherboard is beeping take the display port cable out and plug back in to the motherboard turn off power supply try again we got boot! save and exit plug display port cable back in to card and we got BOOT! yes! odd little routine you may encounter (saw the you tube later its a thing) as everyone says re-sizeable bar is needed it will run with out but......install the bifrost software first it has the rgb stuff then the intel driversthe intel drivers have a crude fan adjust and also some power adjustments(side note this gpu will heat the room (brave little toaster) it makes alot of heat)be cautious with the boost one it isnt very stable I leave it at 0 same with the voltage offsetI did the beta as it pertains to d4 all settings to high I can see its using 11gb of the ram and its runs nice be sure to enable xess I went balancedupdate was messing around with D4 cranked the settings to ultra and WOW beautiful!! I watched it use 16gb of the card STUTTER FREEI bought the 4060ti and returned it because even at high settings it maxxed the ram this card runs D4 very well at ultra 1440plate june beta driver updateupdate I used the boost 0.5 makes thing thing spin at 2700mhz and stable! not bad!UPDATE 8-15-2023 Firmware updateusing 30 boost 0 preload 240w limit 80º temp limit and aggressive fan curveeven better than before less heat more fps at max and the low fps is way upits still a Beast of a card and is exceeding my expectations as a gamer I dont use the streaming but I hear its top notchI curbed the max temp for no other reason than why? its fast enough w/o letting it run that hot

reviews.reviewTitle: The newest drivers really makes this a stupendous value.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this a couple of months ago and returned it for instability reasons. Gave it another shot and don't regret it. I swapped out my Nvidia 3060 for this and the VRAM is the biggest bonus. All the newest cards are coming out with yesterdays memory specs of 8Gb and charging double. I have this card running my whole Adobe suite, Davinci Resolve and Blender and it just smokes through everything.You absolutely need a motherboard and processor that has a Rebar option to take advantage of it's power or this card will NOT work. Z690 or Z790 and a 12th or 13th gen Intel is the ideal setup so you can also use the Deep Link technology. This card also has AV1 encoders and decoders which is the future, especially if you do Youtube channels. You would have to buy a RTX40 series for that at 3 times the price.If you set up your card with new complimenting hardware, it really does work well. If you are installing this on a 4 year old computer and complaining it doesn't work....well.

Amazing card, as of right now didn't have a single issue with it. Well, besides needing a newer display port cable to support the 2.1spec, I had an old 1.4 spec cable and that gave me artefacts and black screens. With a new cable all issues are solved.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bonne carte vidéo gamer bas budjets
reviews.reviewText: Mis à part que le seule driver disponible date d'il y a un an c'est une bonne carte video entrée/milieu de gamme conçue pour l'overclocking qui donne des perfomance vraiment intéressantes avec le raytracing et les détails élevés en 1080 et en 1440 grace à ses 16 gb de vram ddr6. Capable de tenir un framerate de 60 à 144 fps selon la grandeur des maps, le niveau de détails demandé et l'overclock appliqué.. livré avec un vieux drivers out of date mais permet de faire la mise à jour vers un qui fonctionne. Capable de tenir le raytracing et un niveau de détails élevé sur Warzone~80fps ,Coldware@144fps fortnite@60+fps , tarkov 80@120fps. Carte stable même lorsque la demande atteind 100%.. Pas du tout déçu en gardant à l'esprit que cette carte est très abordable parfait pour les gamers débutants ou avec peu de moyens.

reviews.reviewTitle: Always a headache. But makes a great night light.
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to like this card, now I am stuck with an extremely expensive night light. It took over 4 hours at first to get it to work with my existing hardware. Drivers are a pain to install."Can't install drivers card isn't present""Can't install the card because there are no drivers"Went back and forth between that for ever. Insane the hoops you have to jump through for this card.Now, just a few days ago, I get a notification that the card has new drivers. Great! Maybe this will help the lag and problems with software I have been experiencing.Nope. Another 4 hours spent ( so far ) and I cannot get this card working at all. I am back to on board video and this card is once again just an EXTREMELY expensive night light. I have had to wipe my entire computer to erase the faulty divers and am now back to where I was before with the constant loop of trying to install drivers to a card that isn't being detected because there are no drivers.Avoid at all costs. Spend a bit more on a better card and save your time and your headaches.

reviews.reviewTitle: PRODUCT HAS SOFTWARE PROBLEMS, GPU NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MANY PRODUCTS
reviews.reviewText: EXPECT TO BE DISSAPOINTED.software compatibility issue's, lots of compatibility issues.Drivers need to be updated by intel.My advice: return it right away if your having issues with the driver installation, or gameplay issues.Most likely it is not your PC, its intels device.intel/ microsoft will say you need to lean install windows, DONT, they are just not taking responsibility for their shotty work, and premature device launch.THE GOOD:if it works, and device installs nicely, the price point of the GPU is amazing, and im sure the hardware will have a decent lifespan from intel. (FANS ARE VERY LOUD) the RGB is very good as well
